DOC.brief_summary: The specific aim study determine pre-existing depression anxiety affect perioperative outcome measure patient undergo surgery pelvic organ prolapse . - Hypothesis 1 : Patients depression increase analgesic use longer hospital stay postoperatively - Hypothesis 2 : Patients anxiety increase analgesic use longer hospital stay postoperatively . A secondary aim characterize incidence severity depression anxiety patient schedule undergo surgery pelvic organ prolapse .
DOC.detailed_description: Objectives : The purpose study assess preoperative depression anxiety patient schedule undergo surgery pelvic organ prolapse determine pre-existing depression anxiety affect perioperative outcome patient population . Methodology : Patients University Oklahoma Urogynecology clinic schedule undergo surgery pelvic organ prolapse invite participate study . Informed consent obtain prior study enrollment . Data obtain preoperative visit participant include demographic information , medical surgical history , complete physical examination . After enrollment study , participant start standardize dose analgesic . The visual analog scale use assess level pain surgical site pain medication adjust necessary . Information regard postoperative course track , include complication , use pain medication , length hospital stay .
DOC.criteria: Age least 21 Scheduled undergo surgery treatment pelvic organ prolapse University Oklahoma Health Sciences Center Age < 21 Inability complete write questionnaire Undergoing concurrent procedure condition pelvic organ prolapse
